Authors:
Fabio Alex Custodio, Thiago de Castro Brommonschenkel,
Athus Diego Azevedo Silva, Olinto Liparini Pereira
Title:
Colletotrichum pereskiae sp. nov. causing anthracnose on
Pereskia aculeata in Brazil
Keywords:
Barbados gooseberry, Cactaceae, Glomerellaceae,
Ora-pro-nóbis, Taxonomy
Abstract:
Pereskia aculeata is a non-conventional vegetable
belonging to the family Cactaceae, native to the Americas. The leaves
are very appreciated in cooking in some Brazilian regions, specially
Minas Gerais. Plants of P. aculeata showing severe leaf spot diseases
end stem rot were observed in in Viçosa, state of Minas Gerais, Brazil.
Colletotrichum sp. were observed associated with the anthracnose disease
and since no records of this fungus (and anthracnose disease) is
reported for this host, the present study has aimed to identify the
Colletotrichum sp. associated to P. aculeata and elucidate the etiology
of the anthracnose disease. Based on morphological characters combined
with phylogenetic data from ITS, GAPDH, CHS-1, HIS3, ACT and TUB2, a new
species, namelly Colletotrichum pereskiae sp. nov., is proposed
belonging to the C. orchidearum complex. A representative isolate was
inoculated on healthy P. aculeata plants and reproduced the severe
symptoms observed in the field. Colletotrichum pereskiae is the
etiological agent of anthracnose on Pereskia aculeata in Brazil.
